section.p: As a technology provider, you own or develop applications which you intend to provide as services in the Cloud using to cover the business-related functionality.
To achieve this goal, you perform the following basic tasks:

ul.li: Prepare your applications for usage in a SaaS model, taking into consideration aspects such as a remote interface, multi-tenancy, high scalability and availability, and security.
Implement the technical interfaces for integrating the applications with .
Provision the applications as technical services in .

section.p: As soon as a technical service is available in , one or more suppliers appointed by you can define actual service offerings, so-called marketable services, for it. The suppliers (or brokers or resellers appointed by them) publish these services to a marketplace, where customers can subscribe to them.

provides specific reports for technology providers. For example, you can retrieve information on the number of subscriptions for your services and on the usage and load of the underlying applications.
As a technology provider, you can also act as a customer in . This means that you are automatically privileged to subscribe to services and work with the services you have subscribed to.
If you also need to perform supplier or marketplace owner tasks, your organization must be assigned the corresponding roles by the operator.
